title: Pork Tenderloin with Garlic and Rosemary
ingredients: 1 tablespoon grape-seed or other high temperature frying oil
directions: Preheat oven to 425º
Make 4 slits in pork with a sharp knife, put 1 slice of garlic and 1 sprig of rosemary in each slit
Heat large, oven safe pan over medium heat. Add oil and brown tenderloin on all sides
Add salt and pepper, place pan on lower over rack and roast for 10 minutes
Remove from oven, add wine, and roast for an additional 10-15 minutes, turning a couple more times
Remove and let rest for 10 minutes before slicing

title: Nonna's Tomato Sauce
description: This is a variation of a standard red sauce that was my Roman grandmother's recipe
directions: Sauté chicken parts in olive oil, add onion, celery, carrot and parsley
Add tomatoes, bouillon cube, basil, salt and pepper
Cook at a rapid simmer, stirring occasionally, for about 30 minutes
Remove chicken, celery and carrot from sauce
Cook pasta in salted water al dente
Serve with grated parmesan cheese

title: Sugo Bolognese (Ragu)
directions: Sauté prosciutto in olive oil until it melts
Add onion, carrot and celery
When mixture gets a light golden color, add meat, breaking it up with a fork
Continue to cook, stirring frequently, until it loses it's pink color
Add garlic and wine
Cook about 10-15 minutes at a brisk heat until wine alcohol evaporates
Lower heat and add cream
Cook gently until cream practically disappears
Add salt, pepper, bouillon cube and tomatoes
Cool gently for about 1 hour, stirring occasionally
Cook pasta in salted water al dente
Serve with grated parmesan cheese

title: Pasta alla Vongole (Pasta with Clam Sauce)
ingredients: 4 medium garlic cloves, 2 smashed and left whole, 2 finely sliced
directions: Heat the oil and the 2 smashed garlic cloves in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until the garlic is gently sizzling. Reduce heat to medium-low and sizzle until garlic is golden brown, about 5 to 7 minutes

Discard the garlic cloves and return the pan to medium-high heat. Add the sliced garlic and pepper flakes and cook, stirring, until the garlic just starts to turn pale golden brown, about 45 seconds (be careful not to burn)
Add the wine, butter, and clams. Cover and cook, shaking the pan occasionally, until the clams open, about 5 minutes. Transfer the clams to a bowl and set the sauce aside
Cook the pasta al dente in salted water. When draining the pasta, reserve 1/2 cup of the liquid, then return the pasta to the pot set over medium-low heat
Pour the sauce and half of the reserved pasta water over the pasta and mix until coated, about 2 minutes, adding more reserved liquid as necessary until the desired consistency is reached
Stir in the clams, parsley, and lemon zest and juice, and season to taste with salt and pepper

title: Suppli
ingredients: 4 cups left over risotto (mushroom, tomato, or bianco)
1/2 pound mozzarella cheese cut into 1/2 x 1/4 inch sticks
Canola or peanut oil for deep frying
directions: Mix together risotto, egg, parmesan cheese, and 1/2 of the breadcrumbs
Shape into an oblong croquette by spreading 1 tablespoon of the risotto mixture in the palm of your hand. In the center place a piece of mozzarella cheese
Cover with another tablespoon of the risotto mixture and form into a croquette
Roll in the remaining breadcrumbs
Refrigerate at least 1 hour before deep frying
Deep fry for 2-3 minutes, until the outside reaches a deep golden brown, and drain on paper towels

title: Cannelloni
directions: Mix together ricotta, egg, mozzarella, and 1/2 cup of the parmesan. If using spinach, cook gently in a pan until wilted, drain and squeeze out all liquid, and add to the mixture
Boil pasta in salted water until al dente and drain
Put some sauce in the bottom of a 9x13 inch pan
Put a large tablespoon of cheese mixture on each pasta sheet and roll
Place each roll in the pan, seam side down, cover with sauce, and sprinkle with additional parmesan
Bake at 350º for about 30 minutes
At this point you can freeze them

title: Sherry Lemon Vinaigrette
directions: Mix all ingredients together and dress salad or vegetables

title: Pasta con Pomodori Arrostiti (Pasta with Roasted Tomatoes)
ingredients: 10 clover of garlic, 4 smashed, 2 minced, 2 chopped
1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped, stems reserved
directions: Preheat oven to 450º

Place diced tomatoes, 2 cloves of chopped garlic, and parsley stems on baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and season lightly with salt and pepper. Roast until tomatoes have a slight char, about 8-10 minutes. Remove from oven and place tomatoes to the side, preserving brown bits from the bottom of the baking pan but discarding garlic and parsley stems

Heat the oil and the 4 smashed garlic cloves in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until the garlic is gently sizzling. Reduce heat to medium-low and sizzle until garlic is golden brown, about 5 to 7 minutes

Discard the garlic cloves and return the pan to medium-high heat. Add the minced garlic and pepper flakes and cook, stirring, until the garlic just starts to turn pale golden brown, about 45 seconds (be careful not to burn)
Add the tomato mixture and cook an additional 1 minute
Add the red wine and cook until alcohol is evaporated, about 1 minute longer
Remove from heat and add butter, stirring until melted. Taste, and season with additional salt if necessary. Set sauce aside
Cook pasta al dente in well salted water and drain, reserving 1/2 cup of the pasta water

Return pasta to the pot, add tomato sauce, chopped parsley, half of the reserved pasta water, and cheese and stir until pasta is coated. Add additional pasta water as needed until desired consistency is reached

title: Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients: 8 chicken thighs, bone-in with skin removed
directions: Remove skin from chicken thighs, salt and pepper both sides
Dredge in flour, and brown both sides in olive oil and butter in a large frying pan on medium heat
Carefully remove chicken from pan and set aside
Add onions, carrot, celery and saut√© until tender
Add wine to de-glaze the pan, and reduce until half of the wine is gone
Add tomatoes, bouillon cube and basil
Return the chicken to the pan, reduce heat and simmer about 45 minutes turning frequently. If chicken becomes dry add some water
Before serving, stir in chopped parsley
